original: Häggström, Erik Johannes, direktör, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 14/8/97 i Malmö av J. H. o. Ida Frölander. G. m. Tyra Fredricsson. Barn: Kerstin f. 35. — Stud:ex. 15, utex. fr. CTH 19. Prakt. v. verkst. i USA 16-17, å ritkont. v. A-B Öresundsvarvet i Landskrona 18, anst. där 20-21, v. A-B B. Dieden i Malmö 21-23, Newport News ShipbuiMing & Dry Dock Co. i Newport News, USA, 23-24, Briksbergs Mek. Verksit. i Gbg 25. ritkont:chef där 26-45, dir. sed. 45. RVO, John Erics-sonM.
translated: Häggström, Erik Johannes, Director, Civil Engineer, from Gothenburg, born on August 14th, 1897 in Malmö to J.H. and Ida Frölander. Married to Tyra Fredricsson in the year 1935 and has a daughter named Kerstin who was born in 1935. Completed secondary school in 1915 and graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1919. Worked as a practical engineer in the USA from 1916-1917 and as a draftsman at A-B Öresundsvarvet in Landskrona in 1918 and was employed there from 1920-1921, worked at A-B B. Dieden in Malmö from 1921-1923, Newport News Shipbuilding & Dry Dock Co. in Newport News, USA, from 1923-1924, Briksbergs Mek. Verksit. in Gothenburg in 1925 and was Head of the Drawing Office there from 1926-1945 and became Director thereafter. Awarded the Order of Vasa and John Ericsson Medal.

workExperience.name: Newport News Shipbuilding & Dry Dock Co.
